reviews.text: Beautiful cathedral. Nice little hike to get up there. Great view of the city
Totally stunning.. byzantine style interior and has a great view spot of Lyon nearby. Use the funicular to get up and dont forget the Roman ruins nearby.
If I could give 10 stars I would have done it...never seen such a beautiful basilic!
Nice Cathedral which is the model for st john the devine in New York city.
Another excellent visit to a gorgeous, historical Cathedral.  You take the tram down from the top and enjoy the view down and the beautiful Cathedral.
Interesting historical place
It's a surprising passageway.
Un super lieu à ne pas manquer lors d'une visite au vieux Lyon
비유리옹의 숨은 명소. 여러 상점들 사이에 있는 철문을 열면 비밀스러운 통로가 열린다.
Superbe endroit qui raconte l'histoire
We were only allowed to take a quick look inside unfortunately. Absolutely stunning building and interior
I was thrilled to see all the old architecture and the fine art.

It's very moving to see how much French magistrates appreciate their stay in Appart'Hotel Garden & City just nearby...But shame on them for basing their rulings on that...And promoting the hotel's owners.
Shame on this village court!
Ok
Impressive building with interesting history.

With the star of the exhibit stolen in May 2017 and the rest hastily covered up by a lackluster exhibition on graffiti, the museum is no longer worth the visit. For an institution backed by both the French government and Catholic Church, one has to wonder at the level of incompetence needed for the loss of priceless relics. Their website still proudly mentions the collection, that said- even the tourist office will still reccomend it. The only way to find out the Fourvière treasure has in fact been stolen is to go there in person and be met with faintly apologetic blithering. One positive note- the entrance fee has been waived out of embarassement.
Very beautiful museum, now under renovation, that's why a street art exhibition is held. Here's some photos
Can see the whole Lyon from here
To visit....

Une plongée incroyable dans l'histoire de notre Cité et des origines du Christianisme. Une muséographie bien conçue et un guide de talent. Plusieurs visites thématiques adaptées aux attentes et aux intérêts des visiteurs. Bref, un très beau moment à passer

Nothing special, you will see while visiting the main Cathedral. They call it the Eiffel of Lyon. You can't go inside and go up. But a nice tower to visit while visiting the Cathedral or the Roman Theater.
Nothing special. That one of Paris is much more impressionant!
No option to go inside the tower. U can go there by fevicular metro lines f2 or by climbing steps.
I mean, it's no Tour Eiffel, but it's a nice walk up here...
From a distance looks like the smaller version of the Eiffel Tower. Beautifully lit at night time.

J'aime cette église beaucoup de croyants encore la fréquente...étant archéologue de formation  je recommande de visiter le quartier pour son histoire originelle et cette eglise. Quartier de petits et vieux immeubles des petites ruelles...beaucoup de charme
Une communaute rayonnante et accueillante au coeur de Lyon.
It's a particular place
One of the beautiful baroque churches of Lyon, very spacious and big. Magnificent, a must see and visit.
Glorious space! Very moving to walk among the choir stalls where the monks would have once prayed. Open each day 3-5pm Monday to Saturday.
Dommage qu' elle ne soit pas accessible.

Une belle œuvre, encore inconnue et intimiste, où l'on peut admirer un intérieur baroque unique à Lyon. A la période de Noël, une magnifique crèche napolitaine est installée par une équipe de bénévoles, bravo à eux.
People there are very helpful. I loved the place, as well as the few operas and concerts I attended. It's so nice to visit. And the recommendations while reserving places online is also so helpful.
Very nice opera house, even low visibility seats are decent and prices are relatively accessible.

Huge! You can see the opera from everywhere!
Contemporanean style with a glass roof.
I like to stay just in front of it because there's few street dancers there and few commerces and restaurants!
Enjoy Lyon Visitors this place is unique
Great opera house. I was not expecting it to be so modern in the inside. Nice acoustic and the "Mefistofele" is great.
Very beautiful opera house!
4* going on 5* when fully occupied. A magnificent landmark hospice/hospital in Lyon, now remodelled for the 21st C.

I am conflicted with this historic site. On one hand, it is an excellent restoration of a historical building. On the other, a very modern aesthetic. As you walk through the old halls, it takes you back and you imagine the old hospital as you read the names of the people that graced the building over the years. Then, you make a turn and come across Beefhouse, Buddha Bar and other modern and trendy spots that, in my opinion, take away from the charm of the place. I would have liked to see the same aesthetic throughout instead of modernizing it in the manner they chose.
Opened even it's not finished, there are a lot of work to do there
A wide variety of stores and restaurants. A bit upscalled, nonetheless a nice venue for an afternoon of shopping...
One of the most beautifully renovated buildings in France. Breathtaking.

This is the iconic place of my hometown.
When the weather is nice you can take amazing pictures!
A must see since it is in the middle of Lyon!
It's always nice to chill out there
Every season this place if full of energy. Lyon made the most beautiful activities to surprise the visitors and the residents. Awesome place!

What a beautiful square, surrounded by beautiful buildings! There is great transport from here to other parts of the city. There is a ferris wheel. Great views up to the fouviére. And access to the shops and main streets of Lyon!
Good place to hang out, relax and many beautiful spots for pictures.
Super fun. We did the dinner cruise aboard Hermès II. Food was good and the staff was friendly.
It is a cruise along Saone river. We can see the old and the new Lyon. Cruise start from rue de Celestines. It takes an hour to discover the city. Awesome experience!

The address is the office address! Don't go there!!! The place where the boat departs is in the city centre not in the south! We wasted one hour just to get to the wrong address... the lady in the office nicely called a taxi for us though...

Excelent trips by ship explained simultaneously in english and french.
I made the Presq'île tour and I would like that the tour were gone also through the Rhone river instead of only through the Shone. Anyway I am quite satisfied with the tour, the ship was modern and comfortable and prices cheap (13 euros for the Presq'île Tour)
Lovely food , very relaxing afternoon

A must for all cinema enthusiasts. Interesting exhibits,many screenings of early movies, and various early cinematography equipment.
Free entrance with the Lyon City Card (highly recommended).  In the souvenir shop they sell many cool posters of their previous film festivals
I was privileged to attended a lecture about and screening of Au Hasard Balthazar at the Institut. It's wonderful to have places still showing these classic treasures.

This museum shows thé genius of of two brothers and their braverhood. Very interesting, I highly recommend it! Useful the audioguide. Not only a filmmaker bit so much more. Also the buildig is very cool
A place that keeps and displays old cinematographic instruments and productions.
Magnifique lieux , je vous le conseille si vous souhaitez découvrir les origines du cinéma
It's a great place for a walk on a sunny day. The murals are a nice work of art.
A shared open space.
top
Very nice modernism!

Eine sehr gelungene Ausstellung, die auf den ersten Blick völlig beiläufig und unauffällig in die Stadt integriert ist. Dabei wird ein ganz neues Miteinander urbaner Architektur und Alltagskunst geschaffen. Das kleine Büchlein, das im Museum erhältlich ist, ist ein guter Helfer, jedoch wünscht man sich des öfteren einen Ansprechpartner, der einem Fragen beantworten kann. Vielleicht buchen wir uns jemanden für unseren nächsten Besuch.
Fascinating stuff! Similar to the V&A and the Met textile galleries in some ways. Very enjoyable and informative. Note most of the information is in French only.
Large collection of fabrics from all the ages but ground floor completely leaks of any explanation in English or any other languages but French. Also the entrance is a bit pricey.

Amazing museum! An absolute must when visiting Lyon. The museum is much bigger than expected with lots of historical French culture. The textile exhibits include some international pieces as well. Every piece in the museum is intricate and beautiful. Well worth the €10 admission (bring a student card for the €7.50 discounted rate).
Lovely small museum - well laid and labelled - highlighting Lyon’s role in the silk industry, with some splendid costumes and tapestry, and a remarkable punch card Jacquard loom.
It is a very interesting place, worth to vist. Realy nice argumnts of the famous lyonaise tissue fabrics. One tickets for all day - 10 Euros. Kid under 12 is free with an adult.

It's hard to say how much I loved that museum. It's hard to imagine how much I loved visiting it, going piece after piece after piece. I couldn't help but wonder how they managed to get so many unique and rare pieces. It's quite moving to see objects, costumes and props so  iconic all in one place. Seeing the hoverboard from Back to The Future II really blew my mind (even if up close, it looks a little shabby, but that's part of the charm and why it makes that prop so interesting). 
Any movie buff should give it chance because you'll be pleased beyond measure. The miniature part, even if not really related to cinema is also quite impressive with a lot of mind blowing pieces. 
If you're really into it, don't trust the 1h30 estimation the museum gives you, you will spend much longer in there.

Hyper cool. Doesn't just have miniatures. In fact, most of it is cool props from movies. I'm sure everyone can find at least one or a few pieces that they love. A good afternoon for all ages. Also a great place for dates as you can spark conversation with each exhibit.

Amazing museum tucked away in Lyon inside a beautiful, old building. Packed full to the brim with amazing throwbacks to major movies, with some truly incredible sets, costumes, and props from all sorts of films from Alien to Batman to Pirates of the Caribbean. Not something to miss!
Beautiful, interesting museum both for the casual tourist and for the hardcore film buff. The incredible miniatures at the end are just icing on the cake.

One of the best museums France has to offer. It contains various original pieces from movies and even having full rooms with exact same arrangements (i.e. Parfumer). Every year there are new pieces added to the collection, therefore confirming Lyon as the city of cinema. You can also find a whole floor with miniatures.
Before deciding if you want to pay the actual entrance fee (6-8€) you can have a sneak peek at the entrance.

Awesome park. Seriously. It's up there with Golden Gate Park in SF and Central Park in New York. We went on a warm day, 70° F, and it felt like all of Lyon was picnicking in the park together. The lawns are awesome to put a blanket down, play games, or just relax with wine and a good book. They have botanical gardens with an awesome variety of plants, a Rose garden, and a zoo. And all of it is free to explore. It was a highlight of our trip to Lyon for sure.
It is a great Park! So many things to do. There is a zoo and a lake in the middle. Many animals live there too. A must visit in Lyon!

It was amazing to have a pleasant surprise after another when  we visited thinking it was just a park. This park has a free zoo with giraffes!! The greenhouse was big and beautiful! Definitely family friendly with playgrounds and activities. The washrooms are free and are placed throughout the park.

Big park, plenty of green space, a lake, an interesting zoo. Plenty of space to ride a bike or rollerskate. A botanical garden, a rose garden. You can find many things in this place and enjoy the nature at the same time 😀
Long history park with big lake,  zoo,  botanical park.  U can cycling around the park.  Bring with your kids.  Lying on the lawn.

Après 30 minutes et 8 "désolé, tous nos conseillers sont en ligne, merci de rappeler plus tard", je n'ai toujours pas eu quelqu'un au téléphone.. 

Merci la Croix Rousse. Un vrai défi d'être client dans votre agence

Agence injoignable 
Service déplorable 
Techniques de vente douteuses ( "avez vous déjà pensé à l'avenir de vos enfants" ?....)
accompagnement personnalisé inexistant . 
Bref A fuir !
Accueil odieux par un monsieur qui devrait revoir son éducation

Si l’envie vous prend d’entrer dans cette agence...fuyez. 
Juste un concentré d’incompétents pas aimables du tout par dessus le marché.
Vraiment je vous assure , ne partez pas dans cette agence. j'ai jamais vu autant d incompétence réunis. Incroyable ...

reviews.author_name: Geekette Bits Great Bits, Tasty Bytes
reviews.text: You can walk down the hill through the beautiful rose and orchard gardens. It’s very steep, paved, and there’s stairs that cut through the winding roads. Once out of the garden you can still walk down another very steep set of steps. When entering the garden you can choose to go left to the orchards and right to the roses. We did left and saw beautiful hydrangeas. Nicely covered and cool.
After the visit to the Basilique notre Dame de Fourvière, scroll down from the green little park. It's refreshing.
Very pretty, very steep. I had a thoroughly enjoyable walk down. Nice and shaded and quiet. Feels secluded.
Gorgeous sights on the walk to Fourviére
Unusual views of the Basilqua.  The rose garden will be great in season

A must for all cinema enthusiasts. Interesting exhibits,many screenings of early movies, and various early cinematography equipment.
Free entrance with the Lyon City Card (highly recommended).  In the souvenir shop they sell many cool posters of their previous film festivals
I was privileged to attended a lecture about and screening of Au Hasard Balthazar at the Institut. It's wonderful to have places still showing these classic treasures.

This museum shows thé genius of of two brothers and their braverhood. Very interesting, I highly recommend it! Useful the audioguide. Not only a filmmaker bit so much more. Also the buildig is very cool
A place that keeps and displays old cinematographic instruments and productions.
Magnifique lieux , je vous le conseille si vous souhaitez découvrir les origines du cinéma

Despite the nice environment of the pub, our experience was not the best. 
The service until 19h was perfect, we had ordered a round of beers which arrived very soon; however when we ask some burgers and another round of beers, the burgers arrived but not the drinks. We had to asked several times for our drinks. Finally we got them almost 30 minutes after, or more.

Additionally, a personal view, the burgers was not tasty. I know the are not to expensive but the taste was average.
Nice place. Good beer. Good music.
Great sports bar you can see anything here on two levels.  Great selection of craft beer especially the Wallace IPA great stuff!!

Pint was good as was the service. Ordered fish and chips. Fish and batter was under cooked. Mushy peas cold. Tartar sauce didn't look, taste or smell too good. Such a shame for a simple dish.. Very surprising.
Super cosy pub! Great variety of beer. The food is also great, and the staff can speak English. The location is just perfect
Le Layon is a beautiful place. I had an excellent fish and must mention that vegetables were some of the best I ever tasted.
We have eated here frogs' legs 😍👌 miam miam miammm - as french people say. Cozy small restaurant, very good service. Really recommended

Great local food on a very nice and calm street. Great option for a dinner and a walk around town after dinner. Staff is friendly and speak very good English. The duck is a great option, medium cook is perfect for this kind of meet.
Wait staff was arrogant and rude. Disappointed in duck breast- dry chew and tough. Frogs legs was good.
Great food at acceptable prices. However, the waiters seem rather unfriendly -  may be because they were really busy....

Personally I loved the place. Ambience was great. And the food itself was great too. All the dishes were made based on the seasonal fresh vegetables, which I lover the concept. Very adequate price range. My friends who were with me didn’t like that much as the quantity was relatively small.
Great food, great wine, great staff. Good job guys. Keep it up 😉
Cute place, nice service, and great wine!!! Definitely worth a visit. Nice outdoor and indoor area.

My partner and I were so lucky to stumble across this beautiful restaurant when we were in Lyon. 

It's the real French cuisine experience served tapas style so you can share and try lots of different dishes which were all extremely delicious. You could just tell that so much thought and love is put into every dish they make and the presentation is amazing.  

On top of this, they have the best wine list and the staff and owners were lovely with great friendly service. We'll definitely be back again! 

My recommendation to others. 100% put this on the top of your list of places to eat when you're in Lyon. Be open-minded about the menu and try lots of different dishes as this is real French cuisine.
Really great food, including a good range for vegetarians, at quite reasonable prices.
The desert was pretty good, and that was the low point of the dinner. Our dishes were just amazing. I had the beef and it was so well cooked...
We came here for a lunch du jour following a recommendation for a Michelin bib, but were not impressed. The soup was almost cold, and the service non existent.
Great food, original waiter !

bonne adresse quoiqu'un peut cher compte tenu des assiettes. 
Le poisson semblait surgelé (pas le reste des plats) néanmoins très bien présenté et très bon. (Nous pensons qu'il était surgelé de par la coupe du filet qui était la même pour chaque assiette de la table)
Le personnel est agréable & le repas de bonne qualité mais pas très copieux.
Très bon restaurant.  Cuisine sans chichis mais succulente. Mon ami est végétarien et même si le menu est presque entièrement composé de viande ils ont préparé de super plats végétariens.

Had a wonderful dinner tonight.
Meals were perfect, waiters perfect.
It was crowded of people but all waiters gave their best to arrange everything.
Place is tremendous, very well decorated 
Reservation is fully required.
Special thanks to Mattea, she did a perfect job, always smiling and with a perfect professionalism. She enjoyed our dinner. So thanks a lot a million times.

We were there on the 23 rd of March and were deeply disappointed by the lack of taste of the food served. The ingredients were of very poor quality as well. The value for money is not good either. Try any other “Bouchon” (local name for restaurant in Lyon) but avoid this loud tourist trap!!!
Really nice place, not so formal as would be expected.. For short: good food, Fast service and relaxed atmosphere! Definitely a place worth visiting with adults or older kids.
Great atmosphere in an elegant, yet informal setting. The service was good and the food was tremendous!
Uh so the fish trio was really good and perfectly prepared. Had a hard time getting a waiter's attention at times but overall a good experience.

Very talented chef, food is really amazing.
Only small thing to get it perfect : we would have liked Arai San to visit the tables when the dinner's finished, to exchange few words about the experience.
Wonderful travel through perfectly adjusted dishes. The proposal to accompany the meals with fruit juices is original and just amazing
Minimalist. You may not understand what the waitrer/ess will tell you. That's part of the experience ;).
Absolutely fantastic
Absolutely terrible - they cancelled our reservation without any communication. Shame on you for ruining our night out!!

The only reason for only five stars is that is the limit on this page.  If only I could give more!
Be it known that this is not a casual restaurant, though the atmosphere is pleasantly relaxed.  Attentive service, direct attention from the chef, a true master of his craft, and . . . not "food," but a series of gastronomic masterpieces all assembled into a coordinated presentation of a dinner to be remembered for the rest of one's life.
Some would say this experience is very pricey  even expensive.  But "expensive" tends to reflect  the perception of value received.  Our experience was worth every Euro.
We came to Lyon to eat, and this was definitely the best meal we had. Attentive and personable service, idyllic setting, and inventive delicious food. Maybe the best meal I've eaten.
Beautiful location, warm welcoming, excellent food and the best service. Thank you so much for a most memorable evening.

A fantastic restaurant with a wonderful meny, a very comprehensive wine list, and a service level of highest rank. Me and my family enjoyed an evening at the restaurant, where we opted for the larger tasting meny. We were first greeted by the chef, and were seated outside in their beautiful garden to enjoy some starters together with a glass of champagne (juice for my two daughters). The chef came by and we discussed the meny and wine options. Afterwards, we were invited to our table, and the feast begun! Every dish was perfectly crafted and presented, and the sequence was timed just right. It took us almost five hours to get through the full meny, and we enjoyed every minute of the experience. We will definitely return to this fine restaurant.

An unforgettable dining experience...

Last night’s dinner with Jean-Christophe and his team was one of the most joyous culinary events of my life.

The restaurant’s setting is amazing, tucked away on an island in an old stone house. I was greeted before I even entered by The Chef and one of the two front-of-the-house staff that served. They invited me to have an aperitif outside, which I enjoyed on several large cushioned couches that lie just outside the entrance. The Chef joined me for several minutes to explain the menu and his rationale for it, and to swap stories about our favorite restaurants in San Francisco.

Once inside, I was taken to my table where I felt like a King. There were only 4-5 tables in this modern and tastefully decorated room arranged in a circular pattern, with great spacing and a calm, almost worshipful aura permeating throughout. The Chef spent a great deal of time out in the dining room explaining the dishes, supporting wine selections and serving the courses side by side his staff. He seemed to truly be a man at peace with his cooking and his restaurant.

And it showed in the food. There was a lollipop starter. A crab and citrus ‘panna cotta.’ The Chef’s signature porcini and foie gras ‘cappuccino’ soup. And a scallop, spinach and truffle lasagna. Mains consisted of a Thai inspired Turbot Tom Yum Goong and a Duck Breast dusted with a 12 spice sachet packet. The various courses spoke to one another and occasionally shared some common ingredients, but each was unique in its presentation and flavors. Multiple desserts followed, including a somewhat surprising cream cake stuffed with artichoke.

Attire was not overly formal - a couple sports coats, many without. The wine list was well chosen, diverse and affordable, and presented on an iPad tablet. The fixed menu pricing is higher than most restaurants, but expected (and dare I even say a good value) for a dining experience of this quality.

The food, service and setting were all truly memorable. Bravo Chef! If you’re a gourmand, add this to your bucket list. HIGHLY Recommended.

Great food, friendly service, and they promise to have you served in time for a trip to the Symphony Hall or Hippodrome if you're dining before heading on.

A varied menu, very well priced in a good atmosphere tucked away off the street level.
I am usually a fan of traditional cuisine. Friends brought me here for a party, the food was good, I liked the staff - very friendly and kind!
This looks like a typical French cheap bistrot you would find in Paris, with tables covered with candle wax, it's cute. There isn't much choice in food though.

Four stars because I didn’t get to try everything. When in Lyon, stop by and try for yourself. The places offers it all, and if we weren't on a tight schedule I would have made an effort to try it all. The streets outside are filled with the air of this gem, how can you not want to try everything in the windows. Grab a treat and stroll the cross streets the stone work is wonderful and snap a couple pictures of the shop, because you will miss it once you get back home. My pictures are taken from in front of the shop off to the right. Lots of hidden gem in Lyon and this shop is tops on my list
Never had a pizza with such soft bread! This place is amazing. The chocolate bread was awesome too! A much appreciated delight in the old town side of Lyon. A must visit.
We decided to try this place since there were such a queue outside and we weren't disappointed, loved the chocolate brioche.

More than a Boulangerie, a cultural experience.  We had to wait in line outdoors for twenty minutes.  In spite os the demand, fresh pastries continued to appear.  I have a fondness for such delights and was not disappointed.
This boulangerie specialises in the lyonnaise brioche and patisserie. The queue at weekend is crazy but the smell coming out of there is amazing

Not to far from the river pain&cie is a quirky little coffee shop. The staff are friendly and helpful. They serve tea/coffee/hot chocolate in bowls which is a bit odd for us. 

They also have delicious cakes, which makes it a definite visit if you enjoy sweet stuff.

The brunch was fresh, didn't feel stale at all

Not amazing. My plate was broken on the side. Knife bent. Table moving. Service could be better. Food is ok. You can do it at home... Coffee is good. However the vinegar dispenser was dirty and not working
The chocolate tart was good but just a bit too heavy for one person. The coffee tasted burned. Either the coffee was poorly prepared or they are using over roasted beans.

Pretty average. Poor service due to rude staff. Pain au chocolat was cold and old. Double espresso was under extracted. I would have put two stars but the aesthetic of the building was nice and the hot chocolate was ok.
No milk alternativ, stressed staff. A little expensive

Despite the nice environment of the pub, our experience was not the best. 
The service until 19h was perfect, we had ordered a round of beers which arrived very soon; however when we ask some burgers and another round of beers, the burgers arrived but not the drinks. We had to asked several times for our drinks. Finally we got them almost 30 minutes after, or more.

Additionally, a personal view, the burgers was not tasty. I know the are not to expensive but the taste was average.
Nice place. Good beer. Good music.
Great sports bar you can see anything here on two levels.  Great selection of craft beer especially the Wallace IPA great stuff!!

Pint was good as was the service. Ordered fish and chips. Fish and batter was under cooked. Mushy peas cold. Tartar sauce didn't look, taste or smell too good. Such a shame for a simple dish.. Very surprising.
Super cosy pub! Great variety of beer. The food is also great, and the staff can speak English. The location is just perfect
